title: Restrict Ranked to champions you have at least rank 2 Champ Mastery in
body:
It was an awesome change back in the day when Rito restricted ranked play to champs you owned.  That cleaned up ranked a lot.  You still have players who come into ranked "1st time Lee Sin", which may or may not be true, but is a pain for the team's morale and certainly not in the spirit of Ranked play.

Level 2 champ mastery is bloody easy to get.  I think I have it on 10 champs now.  Two months from now, everyone will have it on all the champs they play with any regularity.  In six months, if you don't have level 2, I really don't want you on that champ on my team in ranked.  

Obviously this can't be implemented immediately, but at least by the end of season 5, let's put together a system so everyone on both teams does bring their A-game to ranked play.  Let's show that you're not new to the champs you play there.  

Who's with me?

This.

Yeah, no, this is a stupid idea.

There is NO retroactive exp toward the mastery system.
Do you know what this means? This means I have to play like 100 games before I'm allowed back into ranked **on my account that has 90 days of playtime.**

This is a terrible idea. Awful.

If retroactive exp into the system was provided? Maybe. But no. I've played over 3000 games. If you make me grind to play the game again, I'm just quitting. I've done my grinding, I've put in the blood/sweat/tears to unlock everything I have.

I've played enough games that if retroactive points were a thing, I'd have all but a handful of champions maxed out (Urgot and Riven mostly, I don't care for them). You can't make me do it again, and you're insane if you think its a good idea-- especially since champion mastery doesnt even prove you're good at the champion. 99% of the points are for win/loss, not for personal performance.

Upvoted.

The only problem I can see arising is that this would drastically reduce player's available champion pools.  And since you can only ban out champions the enemy team can play, you could essentially ban out the enemy team's only remaining champions.

I hardly have time to play anymore, and my time is only getting more scarce. I'd be pissed if I was forced to pick Janna in jungle since I didn't put many games into Amumu/Udyr recently, even though they're two of my best champions/pocket picks. That's one of my main gripes with the champion mastery system, I wish they could at least use match history to calculate mastery, so you don't have to grind all over again to show you know how to play a champion.

Alright.

50 games is a decent chunk. This gives me access to roughly 8% of the champion roster. I'm capable of playing roughly 95% of the champion roster. I frequently pick different champions for different situations. This would prohibit me from doing so.

Next. If I want the other 92% of the champions in the game, I have to play **_500 some matches._** That is a metric shit ton of games. That is nearly **11 days of playtime.** So no, no this isn't a remotely good idea.

Champion mastery is arbitrary anyways. Its a pointless system that says you've played the champion 2-4 times before. This is a completely pointless gate, with a completely trash and pointless system.

You're right. I'd play the three-four champions I like **frequently** playing to champion mastery 2. I would **not** play 16 champions to mastery 2 because I'd have to be deliberately doing so, and I would certainly not be even capable of playing the entire roster to mastery 2, nor would I want to.
I don't want to grind. I'm done grinding. I've played this game for going-on 100 days, I have proved my worth. But that's just me personally-- for everybody else, I doubt they want to grind either... Unless they also think that somehow this god-awful system where someone gets carried for 2 games proves that they're better than the next guy actually carries some sort of merit.

How do I fix the problem? Honestly, I don't because it isn't a problem. The percentage of people who first-time a champion in ranked is not that high. It isn't worth inconveniencing or even outright banning a large portion of the community, casual or otherwise, from ranked play.
If we were to start somewhere to clean up ranked play, I'd probably start at an actual problem like trolls in champion-select-- something preventable that _likely_ won't impact many innocent players, unlike this proposed fix that impacts _every_ innocent player.
Even then, there are problems. Do we impliment a vote-kick system? What stops this from being abused (WTF Kick, Bard isn't OP enough. WTF Kick, taking teleport midlane. Ect,Ect).

Realistically, there are no good fixes for the ranked system, or else they'd likely already be implemented. Champion mastery is definitely not the way to go. If someone is comfortable enough to pick the champion, they should be free to play it. If it upsets you **that** greatly, try the magnificence of queue-dodging.

Seriously, I've gotten to Diamond 3 before, Plat several times edging on yet another on a side account, and mostly because I don't care THAT much. In the moment, in the heat of things, sure I get mad or frustrated, but overall the best attitude is almost a casual one-- just play to play, if you're good you'll climb. Maybe those casuals you oh-so-dislike have a leg up on you in this category.

Ranked is not intended to be restricted. It is meant to be open to the good, the bad, the casuals, and the tryhards. Everybody deserves their shot, whether you seem to think so or not.

You made some interesting points in this, but some of them are not entirely edging on your side.

You say you already have 3-4 champions good to go, now I need to bring in some information considering the OP, that if this change were to be implemented, it would be several months from now, not barring anyone from ranked play for a serious amount of time, about 6 months worth of time, and for most players, 2-4 matches on around 16 characters is about par for the course for such a long stretch of time due to Fotm and all that. It wouldn't even really be a grind, people would just be playing champions in a normal way.

You never needed to play the entire champion roster to master 2, you only need to play the 3-4 that you like, maybe a few more for yourself, and some other picks that you think are useful, lets be entirely honest here, do you really need the entire champion roster on such a regular basis? If the answer to that isn't no, you've seen some incredibly diverse matches before.

The problem with ranked isn't necessarily just new players playing new champions, its really a compound problem that will need a series of solutions at least as drastic as this one to fully patch up, you mentioned one, the trolling aspect. this aspect is too large to fix with anything small, so to fix it there would need to be some massive thing to change it, namely, a good tribunal.

"Realistically there is no fix for ranked system" is something that I would have to disagree wit you about, there is a fix that should be implemented, but it has not been discovered yet. everything can be fixed, everything can be cured, sometimes its not pretty, but it is possible. even if it isn't, the best you can do is work on it and hope, because there are a lot of problems that need the change.

Honestly I'm gonna agree with you on the last part, My previous comment concerning that I said after playing a game with one of the most casual toxics I will ever see, saying its just a game after building ad Annie mid and feeding hard, I got blamed for that too. casuals as a whole are no problem, they can be annoying , but that is chalked up to the players themselves.

You said you made it to diamond with a casual attitude, I don't know what season that was in, but had you gone in with spirit you might have made it to challenger, because you only went in with half of yourself, instead of all of yourself.

Also, as a final note to this comment, you say you play capably 95% of the champions, but after that you say you only play 3-4. are you then implying that you don't often play the other ones. This means that though you can play them well enough, that you don't have them practiced as well as you could possibly, because I myself are pushing for this change and I too can say with utmost certainty that I can play around 95% of champions effectively, but I could care less for the most of them.

I'd only get champion mastery on all of these other champions if I particularly try to-- Right now, I don't play very often. When I do play, its usually my favorite champion, a lot of my gaming fervor has died between college taking over, and my decay out of Diamond.

Again, for a better excuse to own every champion in ranked, trading is a thing. For my personal excuse, yes, any time I get an unfavorable match-up or feel like changing things up, I'll play a different champion. I do have my favorite champions, but I also pride myself as a bit of a generalist. I might not be the _best_ say, Zac player, but if Zac fits what I need at the time the reward outweights the lost "mastery." Over the course of my ranked history, I've played all but a handful of champions multiple times-- and its simply because I don't own the last few.

I'll skip over the alternative fixes for ranked-- You're probably right, in an ideal world we would have found a fix, but nobody has it atm and it isn't a simple problem, so chances are there wont be any fixes for quite some time.

Yes, people can be toxic, but at least its not _thaaaat_ often. The systems in place seem to be doing a pretty good job at cleaning up the game though, I've seen far less than I have in previous seasons. The worst I usually get is a negative nancy.

I strongly believe that Diamond 3 was as skilled as I've ever been. That was realistically my skillcap, between ping, bad decision making, and sub-optimal reaction times. Maybe in the future I'll do better, but casual or not I don't think I'd have done better. Having a more relaxed, casual mindset is honestly the best way to climb. I'm not a huge fan of them, but have you ever checked out pro-streamers? The general attitude is just "it's just one game, doesn't matter in the long run."
That isn't to say they don't try, its just that they're very much more casual and relaxed about the situation. This is what I was getting at.

For the last paragraph, I addressed it earlier. It's of my personal belief that teamcomps and counter-picks are strong enough points to substitute out a little champion mastery in exchange for. A bad teamcomp or an un-winnable lane crushes your team at champion select. Knowing how to play all champions and being willing to play all of them is a great boon, even if it means playing a champion you've yet to "master."

I'll just have you know, that throughout this argument, the voice that I assigned to you in my head has changed from "Raving lunatic that can't support good ideas" to "Sensible human being with interesting points." no real relevance there, Just wanted to say it.

To the points in the argument, firstly, college is an issue, but it is a temporary one, and in a span of six months you should achieve the master lvl two on a good deal, even if you can only do it in your spare time.

I figured the trading thing would be important, but in solo que its less of an issue, and I think I already mentioned that I do not think this change should affect ranked teams at all.

When it comes to people being toxic, I suppose your right, but I was really irked that game.

When it comes to your comment on diamond 3 being your skillcap, I must say that that is again untrue, you can be as good as anyone, even better. I can say this without knowing you because It's true of everyone, because everyone brings something different to the table. 

I think our definition of a casual differ, when you say casual, you think of someone who is relaxed, loose, but familiar with how the game is played. This is how I try to play the game.

When I say casual, I mean someone who doesn't care about what anyone says, and does whatever they want to in the game, using the oh so popular "its just a game" as a shield to feed without being reprimanded. this happens to me too often.

And your final point is a double edged sword really, counter picks are strong, but only when your equally skilled with your as they are to you, teamcomp is important, but not as important as champion familiarity.

I suppose it's time to dig this out again, because the idea again surfaced in my mind, and I have a question pertaining to the origin of this argument.

Do you still think in 4 months most people will not have enough champions at level 2 mastery to play ranked, if this change were to come. I ask this because of a lot of reasons, mostly because you had a strong viewpoint on the matter, and you seem intelligent and not irrational.
Hope you have great game, enjoy the rest of your day.
It took me two wins in normals to get champion mastery 2 on {{champion:412}} Thats about an hour and a half

Yea, it wouldn't be bad if I had more time, but it's the per champion bit plus the fact that it doesn't count anything prior to its release, even though as far as I know they use the same data as match history. Like Faker goes into a game on his main with LeBlanc and it will tell him he's a newbie on the champ.

It's not a make or break criticism on it, honestly it just makes me care less about the whole thing, which just sucks since I think it could be more exciting.

This was mentioned back in the days of the old forums but with "number of times played" instead of mastery level.

The flaws in this are that people would not be able to go to another position based on their limited mastery pool, possibly causing someone who isn't comfortable with a role to be forced to take a non-meta pick like Rammus mid even if they owned champs like Ahri or Talon.

Trading would be even more limited as people wouldn't even be able to pick a champ that they didn't have enough mastery points in, even if they didn't intend to play as the champion they picked.

People have said on this post that it takes about 3-4 games (approx 30 minutes each) to reach rank 2, and because of the ban and pick phases of ranked, you'd need 16 champions at level 2 in order to even queue. That's 24-32 hours of playing, assuming that you'd only play a champ until they're level 2 and on modes you can get mastery, AFTER the mastery system was introduced before **anybody** would be allowed to enter a ranked queue. Even after the 30 hours, you'd still have only a small selection of champs to choose from. Considering how little experience 3 games actually gives to a player, this seems to put an unnecessary obstacle on players for whatever someone learned in those games, win or loss.

Another one of those again?

Why people treat ranked like it's some "Elite Players Only"? That's not how it's supposed to work - Ranked is there precisely to measure your skill level in comparison to other players. If you choose to play champions that you don't know well, it's your business - and while we all hate getting that "First time Zed in ranked" player, it just doesn't happen often enough to have any real impact on anything.

I could imagine it working with Level 1 (that is at least 1 game played before playing ranked), but that's about it. League already have huge restrictions on ranked play (16 champions owned and Summoner Level 30) compared to other games.

In other words - Ranked shouldn't be restricted.

16 is out of necessity. It isn't actually restricted at all besides you have to be level thirty. It needs to be higher in restriction. Normals needs to account for some score and you need a base level score to enter ranked games. That would be something some would call harsh.
I don't know why people insist on players being good before being able to play ranked.  Play ranked when you're not good?  You get a lower rank.  That's what Bronze League is for.

The new mastery system means absolutely nothing except you play that champ a lot. It does not mean you have skill with the champ. It does not mean you win when you play that champ. All it means is you get a shiny title because you put in time on a particular champ over and over. What a Joke....

Notice that it's a **range.**

This range is based on how many points it takes to go up ranks, and how many points you get per win or per loss.

On average, a win grants over 1100 points (I've generally gotten 1200+ points per win).
On average, a loss grants about 200 points, give or take 50.

You get around 6 times as much from wins as losses. And the only constant between games is yourself; your allies may be better or worse in the next game, and the same is true of your opponents. This is without accounting for overt trolls.

I'm not saying it will always take 20 games, or that it will always take 4 games. I'm saying it takes somewhere in the range of 4-20 games per champion, and you need 16 champions to be allowed into Ranked play due to pick/ban phase.
